There are five things a clever woman should know:
First, knowing her husband's thoughts;
Second, knowing whether her husband thinks of her or not;
Third, knowing the cause of the conception;

The elder's wife replied to the elder, saying:

The elder was delighted and made offerings of clothing and food every day, making them extremely fine.
After ten months had passed, she gave birth to a boy. Five wet nurses jointly raised the child:
One who breastfed, one who fed him with her mouth, one who bathed him, one who clothed him, and one who held him.
The child then grew up. At the age of fifteen or sixteen, the elder and his wife sought a wife for their son.
They obtained a daughter of another elder, who was upright and beautiful.
Outside the city, in the garden pavilion, they invited many guests to a feast, with fine food and entertainment, and delicacies of all kinds, with no one turned away from the four directions.
In this way, the guests stayed for seven days.
At that time, the couple was strolling in the garden. There was a tree called no sorrow, with flowers on it, very colorful and beautiful, like light red color.
The wife said to her husband:
I want to get these flowers.
The husband then climbed the tree to pick the flowers. The tree branches were thin and weak, and immediately collapsed, causing the child to fall to the ground and die.

The parents heard about it and knew that he had fallen from the tree and died. They rushed over. The mother held his head and the father held his two legs. They rubbed and looked at him, but he was forever gone and not revived.
The parents grieved and wailed, their five internal organs shattered. The guests who saw it also grieved on their behalf:
How sudden and swift is death? The guests' food and entertainment were not yet finished, yet he fell from the tree and died. Impermanence!

At that time, the World-Honored Buddha was together with Ananda, wearing robes and carrying alms bowls, entering the city to collect alms. He saw the elder couple, who had only one child who had fallen and died from a tree, crying and grieving, with words of extreme sorrow.

The Buddha saw where the child had come from and been born. He had a lifespan of exhaustion in the Heaven of the Thirty-three, passed away, and was reborn in the elder's home. Ananda said:
Yes!
He then followed the Buddha and went to the elder's place.
The elder, hearing that the Buddha had come to his place, was delighted in his heart and bowed at the Buddha's feet.

The Buddha said to the elder:
When people are born, they die. When things are formed, they decay. When the appointed time comes and life ends, there is no escape or hiding.
Give up your worries and do not grieve anymore.
At that time, the Buddha emitted light that illuminated the ten directions, causing the elder to see his parents in the heavens and dragons crying.
The Buddha said to the elder:

This child originally came to be born in your family after his life in the Heaven of the Thirty-three ended. When his life ended, he was born among dragons. The king of the garuá¸as then took him and ate him. The three places cried together at the same time, asking whose child he was?
The Buddha then spoke a verse, saying:
Are the sons of the celestial sons in the heavens your sons?
Are you the son of the dragons and spirits in the dragons?
At that time, the Buddha himself explained, saying:
They are not the sons of the celestial sons, nor are they your sons, nor are they the sons of the dragons.
The causes and conditions of birth and death are impermanent, like an illusion.
Everything does not last long, like a passing guest.
The Buddha said to the elder:
Death cannot be obtained, and past events do not follow.
The elder said to the Buddha:
What are the sins and merits of this child in his past lives?
He was born in a wealthy and noble family, but his life was short. What does this mean?
The Buddha said:
In his past life, this child liked to give generously and respected others. Because of this meritorious virtue, he was born in a wealthy and noble family;
He liked to hunt and kill living beings. Because of this, his life was short.
Good and evil follow people, like a shadow follows a form.
The elder leaped with joy and attained the acceptance of the Dharma.
The Buddha spoke like this, and the elder couple and the entire assembly all joyfully accepted it.
